arm_group.arm_group_label: EVLA, phlebectomies & Trlop closure of incompetent perforators
arm_group.description: endovenous laser ablation (EVLA) of great saphenous vein (GSV) plus phlebectomies plus TRansluminal Occlusion of Perforators (TRLOP) closure of incompetent perforators.
endovenous laser ablation (EVLA) of great saphenous vein (GSV) + phlebectomies.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this randomised case-controlled trial is to investigate whether ablation of
      incompetent perforating vein in addition to ablation of truncal vein reduces the rate of
      recurrent varicose veins post-treatment compared with patients who only have ablation of the
      truncal vein, who are left with untreated incompetent perforating veins.

clinical_study.brief_title: RCT - Does Treating Incompetent Perforators Reduce Recurrence?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Primary varicose veins caused by great saphenous vein reflux

          -  At least one incompetent perforating vein refluxing into the varicosities

          -  Over 18 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Reflux from pelvic vein origin or small saphenous vein

          -  Previous varicose vein surgery,

          -  Incompetent perforators remote from the varicosities treated,

          -  Deep vein incompetence

          -  Deep vein obstruction or occlusion

arm_group_label: EVLA, phlebectomies & Trlop closure of incompetent perforators
intervention.description: Endovenous laser ablation of great saphenous vein

intervention.description: TRansluminal Occlusion of Perforators (TRLOP) closure of incompetent perforators.

keyword: TRansluminal Occlusion of Perforators (TRLOP) closure of incompetent perforators.
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised Controlled Study to Determine Whether Treating Incompetent Perforating Veins at the Time of Endothermal Varicose Vein Surgery for Truncal Reflux Reduces Recurrence After Varicose Vein Treatments.

primary_outcome.description:
Differences in the level of significant recurrence between the two treatment pathways at each follow up.
Significant recurrence would be indicated if the participant demonstrates varicose veins greater than 3mm in diameter, varicose veins associated with thrombophlebitis or skin changes such as venous eczema, red skin or brown skin overlying the veins which require further treatment.
primary_outcome.measure: Differences in the level of significant recurrence between the two treatment pathways
primary_outcome.time_frame: Four weeks, three months, six months, one year, two years, three years, four years and five years post-surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Evidence of insignificant recurrence - thread veins, reticular veins or varicose veins less than 3mm in diameter.
secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in insignificant recurrence between the two treatment pathways
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Four weeks, three months, six months, one year, two years, three years, four years and five years post-surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Patient reported symptom severity - the Aberdeen questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Four weeks, three months, six months, one year, two years, three years, four years and five years post-surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Patient reported quality of life - The Chronic Venous Insufficiency Questionnaire (CIVIQ)
